title: PowerShell completion support

type.name: Feature
type.description: A request, idea, or new functionality

body:
### Verification

- [x] This issue's title and/or description do not reference a single formula e.g. `brew install wget`. If they do, open an issue at https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-core/issues/new/choose instead.

### Provide a detailed description of the proposed feature

It would be great to add PowerShell completion support. I see from <https://github.com/Homebrew/brew/blob/0e1d94506837ff39def056eaa365fa4d6aa07ca8/Library/Homebrew/formula.rb#L2097> that it's not currently supported. While the [best way](https://github.com/powershell/powershell/issues/17283) to do it isn't yet supported - and may never be - there are some possibilities like conditionally adding a `$profile` (default is easy to compute) or, if it exists, conditionally append some lines to `$profile` to check the homebrew library directory for pwsh completions.

### What is the motivation for the feature?

I use a lot of bash and PowerShell, and having completions in bash is nice but I miss them in PowerShell.

### How will the feature be relevant to at least 90% of Homebrew users?

For those who use PowerShell as their shell, this would benefit them all. I doubt that's 90% of homebrew users and probably a far cry from the other shells, but I'm sure the other shells probably don't have 90% either. Well, maybe bash. But given zsh is the default shell in macOS for a while, perhaps not.

### What alternatives to the feature have been considered?

I could do the work in a formula that would do this, but I thought it would make sense to update the existing function that all formula can use to support it. I'd be happy to contribute as well.
